result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean M Klopatek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dean M Klopatek in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to strike Repeater language on both counts, Court orders Repeater struck.   Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.Court finds both counts to be DVI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Dean M Klopatek in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on May 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Dean M Klopatek in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court provides copy of complaint. Counsel waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
w/conditions:  Absolute sobriety; No contact with TT directly or indirectly; absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed

Defendant Dean M Klopatek appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel appearing as a friend to the Court advising the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Counsel waives reading.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.  Defendant indicates will be retaining private counsel.  Court finds probable cause.  State advises there is a PO hold at this time, requesting $500 cash bail w/conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
